message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The thickened skin with a wide-set nose and repeated episodes of severely itchy rashes since birth suggest hyperimmunoglobulin E syndrome (HIES) which is caused by a mutation in STAT3 gene. Adenosine deaminase deficiency causes severe combined immunodeficiency, LYST gene mutations cause Chediak-Higashi syndrome, and WAS gene mutations cause Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome, none of which fit the patient's symptoms.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The thickened skin with a wide-set nose, along with the itchy rash and history of abscesses, suggests hyper-IgE syndrome, which is caused by a mutation in STAT3 gene. The other options are not associated with hyper-IgE syndrome.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and history suggest Hyperimmunoglobulin E syndrome (HIES). HIES is most commonly caused by a mutation in STAT3 gene. The other options are related to other conditions like Adenosine deaminase deficiency (ADA-SCID), Chediak-Higashi Syndrome (LYST mutations) and Wiskott-Aldrich Syndrome (WAS mutations).

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The thickened skin with a wide-set nose and recurring infections suggest hyper-IgE syndrome, also known as Job syndrome. Hyper-IgE syndrome is caused by a mutation in the STAT3 gene.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The thickened skin and wide-set nose suggest a possible diagnosis of hyper-IgE syndrome, which is caused by a mutation in the STAT3 gene. The other options are not associated with this condition.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, including the eczematous rash and thickened skin with a wide-set nose, suggest hyperimmunoglobulin E syndrome (HIES), also known as Job syndrome. HIES is caused by a mutation in the STAT3 gene. Adenosine deaminase deficiency causes severe combined immunodeficiency, LYST gene mutations cause Chediak-Higashi syndrome, and WAS gene mutations cause Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome, which do not match the patient's symptoms.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The thickened skin with a wide-set nose suggests hyper IgE syndrome. Among the options, only a mutation in the STAT3 gene is associated with hyper IgE syndrome. Adenosine deaminase deficiency causes severe combined immunodeficiency, LYST mutation causes Chediak-Higashi syndrome, and WAS mutation causes Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome, which do not match the patient's presentation.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and past medical history are suggestive of Hyper-IgE Syndrome (HIES), also known as Job syndrome. The thickened skin, wide-set nose, and recurrent skin infections are common features of HIES. Among the options, only STAT3 gene mutations are associated with HIES.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The thickened skin with a wide-set nose and intermittent itchy rashes since birth suggest atopic dermatitis, and among the options, only a mutation in STAT3 is associated with atopic dermatitis. Adenosine deaminase mutations lead to severe combined immunodeficiency, LYST mutations lead to Chediak-Higashi syndrome, and WAS mutations lead to Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome, which do not fit with the presenting symptoms.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of a thickened skin with a wide-set nose and recurring severely itchy rashes suggests hyper-IgE syndrome, which is caused by a mutation in the STAT3 gene. Adenosine deaminase deficiency causes severe combined immunodeficiency, LYST mutations cause Chediak-Higashi syndrome, and WAS mutations cause Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome, which do not have the same symptoms as hyper-IgE syndrome.
